newsitem.title: UK: LCE white sugar end slightly weaker in tight range.
newsitem.headline: LCE white sugar end slightly weaker in tight range.

text.p: White sugar futures were held in their tight price range at the close despite a healthy turnover on Wednesday, traders said. The New York raw futures failed to give direction to London, traders said, and activity was broadly confined to the front three positions with outright purchases peppered with switches and crosses seen from brokerages.
October closed at $353.50, up just $0.20 and $2.00 off the contract's life time high recorded earlier. It traded a market-dominating 1,602 lots.
The December contract finished at $346.40, down $0.40 having turned over 317 lots.
Most positions weakened slightly after the New York opening and nearby white sugar spreads remained relatively steady.
Movements were also marginal in Paris where 733 lots were traded on the Matif exchange. October was up just 10 cents at $353.10 and December down 50 cents at $347.00.
